action.action-desc: Mr. McCaul (for himself and Mr. Castro of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for the termination of residential or motor vehicle leases and telephone service contracts for Foreign Service officers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Service Officer Civil Relief Act of 2018.

section.header: Termination of residential or motor vehicle leases and telephone service contracts for certain Foreign Service officers

subsection.text: Chapter 9 of title I of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 (22 U.S.C. 4081 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Termination of residential or motor vehicle leases and telephone service contracts
section.text: The terms governing the termination of residential or motor vehicle leases and telephone service contracts described in sections 305 and 305A, respectively of the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (50 U.S.C. 3955 and 3956) with respect to servicemembers who receive military orders described in such Act shall apply in the same manner and to the same extent to members of the Service who are posted abroad at a Foreign Service post in accordance with this Act.

subsection.text: The table of contents in section 2 of the Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 906 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 907. Termination of residential or motor vehicle leases and telephone service contracts.
